result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwain A Foreman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With credit for 5 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including: supervision fees and DNA surcharges during  period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No violent contact with victim.
No physical discipline.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Failure to timely sign up for probation will be considered a violation.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction.

House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwain A Foreman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent also in Court.   Defendant is progressing on Probation.  No further reviews are requested.
CORRECTION: Sentencing Entry reflects corrected information.

JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE GRADY
Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 5 DAYS time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS (as to count 1) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim.
-No contact with firearms.
-No physical discipline.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Failure to timely sign up for probation will considered a violation.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Received & Filed, Amended Information. Information Reads AS:
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis Stat. 947.01(1), a class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood, who appeared via telephone.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Defense counsel unable to appear in court due to medical issue. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn.

Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Mathew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. State advised the court that they may file an adjournment.  Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/16/2014.

Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Matthew J Torbenson for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Michael Davis Thurston for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ZF (1/13/04), UNLESS VIA TELEPHONE AND NO DISCUSSION OF THIS CASE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antwain A Foreman in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Antwain A Foreman in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
